file_content.text: Nadia! Don't you ever--what were you thinking? He might have killed you!
I'm sorry, Father. I couldn't just hide while you were in danger!
Charming. Really.
You--we'll talk later, Nadia. The planet's looking dreadfully close, and I saw that Sith lock the navigational computer.
He seemed very intent on killing you all. Do you know why?
Why did the Sith do this?
To destroy the Rift Alliance and hurt the Republic, I'd say.
Is there any way to override the Sith's commands or shut off the engines?
Could we unlock it?
The crew knew how, but the Sith--they're all gone.
If you can all stop arguing for a moment, anything you know about the ship could be useful.
Quit chattering and help.
We're passengers! What could we possibly know?
That Sith also destroyed the life support and fire control systems. So I hope you have another ship for us to evacuate onto.
Please! I d-don't want to die!
Shush, Blaesus. Jedi... could we overload one of the engines to change course? We'd likely hit Deralia's moon instead, but there'd be time to escape... just.
Starship engines have fail-safes built in. There won't be time to overload it and evacuate everyone.
That's no easy task.
Obviously, the Sith would have turned the fail-safes off when they locked our course.
I don't want to risk crashing on top of innocent people.
Is the moon inhabited?
No, no! The moon is totally lifeless. I'd never suggest it otherwise.
That's dangerous, but better the moon than Deralia, I suppose.
It would save the planet....
Yes, yes, I thought so. Millions could die if we hit the planet.
Wait! We can't do that! If we crash the ship into the moon, it--
We don't have time for your babbling, child!
I want to hear what she has to say. Go ahead, Nadia.
Let her speak.
She may have a better idea. Let's hear her out, first.
I need all the options.
If the Fortitude crashes into Deralia's moon, it'll change the planet's tides. Whole cities might flood!
But... the Fortitude's thrusters still work. If we work together, maybe we could steer the ship into orbit instead.
You'd need to take everyone to the controls, right away. But we could save Deralia and the moon--and the ship could be salvaged.
Can't the thrusters be controlled from here?
Where are the controls?
We'd need to steer manually. The consoles are around the ship, I'll show you.
Without the computer, we could still hit Deralia.
We'd be flying blind.
I can monitor our course from here.
These people aren't Republic officers. They've never flown a ship before.
But none of them are trained.
They just need to know when to turn the thrusters on and off. I can tell them.
Which, Jedi? Time's short! Either we steer the ship, or you'll need to crash it into the moon.
We'll each man one of the thrusters and get the Fortitude to safety.
Let's try steering the ship.
Even if we can't get it into orbit, maybe we can give the Fortitude a safer landing.
Steering's the best chance.
I'll stay here and guide everyone. Even I can miss a planet.
Take too long. Ship will crash before then.
It's alright, Duin. Everyone, stay close to the Jedi until you find a console! Quick, now!
I'll overload one of the engines. Everyone else evacuate the Fortitude. Now.
We're crashing the ship.
There's no time to argue. I'll overload one of the engines; everyone else evacuate.
I agree. Let's crash the ship.
Y--yes, Master Jedi. I understand.
From one doomed ship into another.
Shush, Duin. Jedi, once the engine is set to overload, get out as soon as you can. Good luck!
